answers.answer: By that list I've had Pre-ecalmpsia forever!  Heck eye problems was one of my first "symptoms", then again I didn't really have any others.

i have been pretty scared about this too. my heart rate has soared, my blood pressure has climbed and my head hurts often. i think the doctor suspects it is on the way, everytime he sees me he pinches my cheeks, feet, ankles and wrists/hands.according to "what to expect when expecting" you would also show protein in your urine, blurred vision, fever, scanty urine output, pain in upper abdomen, restlessness, twitching and/or irregular kidney function. those symptoms go with the swelling, high heart rate, high blood pressure, headaches and rapid weight gain.they also say pregnant women with preeclampsia may experience any or all of these symptoms.i hope this is not what it is for either of us. good luck :)

Thanks guys. I go to the doctor today, so they will check my urine and hopefully the doctor will have some sort of idea where to go from here, since my blood pressure medication is not really working much.
i had it with my son and the symptoms i got were sickness and headaches. they were bout 2 take me in 2 induce me when i started on my own,that was at 38wks.

I have the severe swelling and the headaches, but my blood pressure is low, like 102/65.  My swelling is worse everyday and now I can't bend my toes and my feet are numb feeling, it is really scaring me but the dr. says I am fine.  They don't even check my swelling, every appt I have to bring it up and he will look at my ancles and say that the only way they will go down it to have the baby.  Let us know what your dr. says today!

i had pre eclamsia with my first child , i had the swellings and was admitted to hospital after my bp reached 170/95 , i was told too that the dyastolic is most importannt and should not be over 95 . protien in urine is the next thing , have you been tested ? you should see your doc it is most important you are looked after ! they wanted to induse me at 36 weeks because of it but my water broke at 35 ! but please keep getting checked out !

And if he doesn't care then you need to find a new doctor! The more I think about how he is acting towards your whole situation the more mad I get! I do not understand what his deal is!!!! Let me know how the appt. goes. I have class til 2 so I'll be around after your appt! Good luck! :)

I had PE with my 2nd baby and with my 3rd I was watched very carefully and my meds were upped gradually until I delivered at 36 weeks...do not mess around with this the baby can be born early and low birth weight as well....if your dr wont treat this appropriately...get another one fast! It isn't worth the health of you or the baby!
I'm with the above poster, Chey!

I hope this isn't too personal, but you said you had PE with your 2nd baby. Was that 2nd baby with the father of your 1st baby also? The reason I'm asking is that I got PE with my first child. I don't really remember the symptoms, but I was young-just 18. I went in for a routine check up and my reflexes were hyper-BP way up and protein in my urine. I look back at pictures of myself right around that time and I am severely swollen. I didn't have a clue though! I just thought it was pregnancy in general, not a problem. I did not have it with my 2nd, 3rd or 4th child, all with the same father. But I am pregnant with my 5th child and I have been told that I again have a chance of having PE because this child is with a different father. I am just curious about it.

My first was with my 1st husband....I was 33 then... I remarried and had my DD at 41 and my DS at 43. I do remember a nurse asking me the same question while in the hospital with DD. I had forgotten about it but she said that some research suggests that the father can have something to do with it. I dont know but I had my 1st son at 34 weeks due to premature rupture of menbranes and my DD was born also at 34 weeks due to the PE. It got really bad...was in the hospital for 7-9 days before I was induced. I never got my normal bp back again after that and had to go on bp meds. IWhen I got preg. with the last baby I was monitored carefully...meds upped as I progressed and I made it to 36 weeks. No PE but I did have the high bp I had with DD...the dr said the risks were the same and the treatment basically the same. The last time around the only difference was no protein in the urine...I do believe that my aggresive monitoring got me to 36 weeks this time...without it I'm sure I would have progressed to PE rapidly and had another premature low birth weight baby....my DD is fine she was 4lb 10ozs my son was 7lb 11ozzs at 4 weeks early! with the high bp...my experience is to err on the cautionary side and treat early so that the outcome is more likely to be good.....:)

question: I was just wondering if anyone that has, or had, preeclampsia could tell me what your physical symptoms started out as. My hands, feet, and ankles are swollen and the swelling doesn't go down after resting. Procardia helped keep my blood pressure normal for around a week, but now the medication is not keeping it down. Today it was 131 over 100, and my doctor said the bottom number is the important one to watch. I am starting to get head aches more frequently, and last week I gained 7 pounds. I go to the doc tomorrow, but I am really worried and was wondering if anyone knows anything I don't...!
title: Preeclampsia
